Class TricolourFlagDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • TricolourFlagDrawer

  • public class TricolourFlagDrawer
extends java.lang.Object
    TricolourFlagDrawer: draws a series of tricolour flags

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double height 
      static double width 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TricolourFlagDrawer() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doChallenge() 
      void doCompletion()
      COMPLETION draws multiple flag made up of three equal size stripes by calling the drawThreeColourFlagCompletion method, passing the appropriate arguments
      void doCore()
      CORE asks user for a position and three colours, then calls the drawThreeColourFlagCore method, passing the appropriate arguments
      void drawThreeColourFlagChallenge(int position, java.lang.String name, boolean type, double left, double top, java.awt.Color stripe1, java.awt.Color stripe2, java.awt.Color stripe3) 
      void drawThreeColourFlagCompletion(boolean type, double left, double top, java.awt.Color stripe1, java.awt.Color stripe2, java.awt.Color stripe3)
      COMPLETION draws a three colour flag consisting of three equal-size stripes at the given position The stripes can be either vertical or horizontal
      void drawThreeColourFlagCore(double left, double top, java.awt.Color stripe1, java.awt.Color stripe2, java.awt.Color stripe3)
      CORE draws a three colour flag consisting of three vertical equal-width stripes at the given position
